text: The 1973 UCI Track Cycling World Championships were the World Championship for track cycling. They took place in San Sebastián, Spain from 22 to 28 August 1973.World Championship Track Cycling 2014-1893 Eleven events were contested, 9 for men (3 for professionals, 6 for amateurs) and 2 for women. ==Medal summary== {| |- bgcolor="#cccccc" | colspan=7 | Men's Professional Events |- |Men's sprint | Robert Van Lancker || Giordano Turrini || Ezio Cardi |- | |Hugh Porter || René Pijnen || Ferdinand Bracke |- |Men's motor-paced | Cees Stam || Piet de Wit || Christian Raymond |- bgcolor="#cccccc" | colspan=7 | Men's Amateur Events |- | |Janusz Kierzkowski || Eduard Rapp || Herman Ponsteen |- |Men's sprint | Daniel Morelon ||Anatoly Lablunowski || Giorgio Rossi |- | | Knut Knudsen || Herman Ponsteen || Ruppert Kratzer |- |Men's team pursuit | Günther Schumacher Peter Vonhof Hans Lutz Günter Haritz || Michael Bennett Rik Evans Ian Hallam William Moore || Gerrie Fens Peter Nieuwenhuis Herman Ponsteen Roy Schuiten |- |Men's motor-paced | Horst Gnas || Rainer Podlesch || Gaby Minneboo |- |Men's tandem | Vladimir Vackar Miloslav Vymazal || Viktor Kopylov Vladimir Semenets || Hans-Jürgen Geschke Werner Otto |- bgcolor="#cccccc" | colspan=7 | Women's Events |- |Women's sprint |Sheila Young |Iva Zajikova |Galina Ermolaeva |- |Women's individual pursuit |Tamara Garkuchina |Keetie Hage |Beryl Burton |} ==Medal table== ==See also== * 1973 UCI Road World Championships ==References== Track cycling Category:UCI Track Cycling World Championships by year Category:International cycle races hosted by Spain Category:1973 in track cycling
title: 1973 UCI Track Cycling World Championships
